articles.name: Defend - Settings
articles.title: Defend - Settings
articles.body:
The Settings menu allows access to the Defend console's main configuration options. When making changes, always select Save Changes at the top-right corner of the screen.

To update, review, and make changes to your settings, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to the Defend console.
  2. Navigate to Settings.
  3. Configure your settings accordingly.
  4. When you have finished making changes, select Save Changes in the top-right corner of the page.

Configurable Settings

The configurable settings are:

  • Banners
    • Choose when each specific banner type is applied to emails.
  • Banner Configuration
    • Select which type of banners are used and enable or disable silent mode.
  • Abuse Mailbox Automation
    • Enter the address the Defend console should monitor for the abuse mailbox and select whether emails should be automatically remediated.
  • Link Rewriting
    • Choose to enable link rewriting and what users will experience when interacting with rewritten links.
  • Summary Page
    • Select whether to display or hide the Report Phish/Report Not Phish, Report Graymail/Not Graymail, and Report Spam/Report Not Spam buttons to users.
  • Harmful Code Removal
    • Select whether to sanitize emails of javascript and other potentially harmful scripts.
  • Quarantine
    • Select what action to take when emails are classified as dangerous or highly dangerous.
  • Admin Features
    • Link to Microsoft 365 to enable the ability to view and remediate emails.
  • User Analysis
    • Link to Microsoft 365 to allow the analysis of historical emails and mailbox details.
  • Allow Filtering By All In Recent Emails
    • This setting can be used to determine which administrators can view all the emails processed on the Recent Emails page. The All threat filter can be enabled or disabled for all admins or just enabled for Global Admins and Admin Policies.
  • Allow View, Download or Delete of an External Email
    • Enable or disable actions administrators can take on external emails.
  • Allow KnowBe4 Intelligence to View Emails
    • Block or enable access for the KnowBe4 Intelligence team to view email content to aid in the investigation and identification of phishing emails.
  • Default Language
    • Select which language banners, summary pages, and link rewriting summaries are written in.
    • If a mail rule language cannot be detected for a user, we will use the default language, which you can choose from the drop-down menu.
    • The languages available for the user experience, including email banners, email summaries, and link scanning, are English, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, Portuguese, Norwegian, and Hungarian.

Recommended Default Settings

The recommended default settings are displayed below:

articles.name: AIDA Knowledge Refresher Guide
articles.title: AIDA Knowledge Refresher Guide
articles.body:
AIDA Knowledge Refreshers enable users to refine their cybersecurity skills and earn badges through bite-sized, scenario-based quizzes, providing a fun and quick way to revisit key takeaways from recent training.

Note: Knowledge Refreshers are available for video modules only.

Knowledge Refreshers are available in the browser version of the Learner Experience. If this agent is enabled, it will appear for eligible content. For more information, view our AIDA Knowledge Refreshers video.

Important: Knowledge Refreshers are only available for customers who have added AIDA. AIDA is available on the KnowBe4 console as an add-on to your Diamond-level subscription.

Enabling Knowledge Refreshers in AIDA Remedial Training

To enable Knowledge Refreshers in a remedial training campaign, log in to your KnowBe4 console and click the Training tab.

  1. Click the AIDA Training subtab.
  2. Make a selection:
    • If you have not configured remedial training, click Configure Training. For more information, see the AIDA Automated Training Guide.
    • If you have already configured remedial training, click Edit Campaign. For more information, see the AIDA Automated Training Guide.

On the AIDA Configure Training page, scroll down to the Knowledge Refreshers section. For more information about the options, see the screenshot and list below:

  1. Enable Knowledge Refreshers: Select this check box to enable knowledge refreshers in the Learner Experience. For more information, see Accessing Knowledge Refreshers in the Learner Experience.
  2. Time between assignment completion and Knowledge Refresher: Select the number of days between when a user completes a training module and when the knowledge refresher for that module is available.
  3. Send Notification to the user when a new Knowledge Refresher is available: Select this check box to notify users when knowledge refreshers are available in their console.
Note:Not all AIDA-assigned training will contain Knowledge Refreshers.

Enabling Knowledge Refreshers in a Training Campaign

Knowledge refreshers are already enabled for training campaigns. To access them, log in to your KnowBe4 console and click the Training tab.

  1. Click the + Create Training Campaign button.
  2. Fill out the appropriate fields on the Create New Training Campaign page. See the Training Campaigns Guide for more information.
  3. Scroll to the bottom of the page until you see the Knowledge Refreshers section.

For more information about the options, see the screenshot and list below:

  1. Enable Knowledge Refreshers: Select this check box to enable knowledge refreshers in the Learner Experience. See Accessing Knowledge Refreshers in the Learner Experience for more information.
  2. Time between assignment completion and Knowledge Refresher: Select the number of days between when a user completes a training module and when the knowledge refresher for that module is available.
  3. Notify users when new Knowledge Refreshers are available: Select this check box to notify users when knowledge refreshers are available in their console.

Accessing Knowledge Refreshers in the Learner Experience

There are two ways to access Knowledge Refreshers in the Learner Experience: from the Dashboard or the Training tab.

Dashboard Tab

Log in to the KnowBe4 Learner Experience. With AIDA enabled, you will see a tile for Knowledge Refreshers if a knowledge refresher is assigned.

Click the Go to Knowledge Refreshers button to open the Knowledge Refreshers page.

Training Tab

Log in to the KnowBe4 Learner Experience and click the Training tab. With AIDA enabled, the Training tab now shows two subtabs: Training and Knowledge Refreshers. Click Knowledge Refreshers to open the Knowledge Refreshers page.

Note: You will only see the Knowledge Refreshers tab if a knowledge refresher has been assigned.

For more information about the options, see the screenshot and list below:

  1. Available: Knowledge Refreshers that are available for the user to take.
  2. Completed: Knowledge Refreshers that users have completed.

Click on a Knowledge Refresher under Available to open it and start the short quiz.

After completing the quiz, the Knowledge Refresher is moved to Completed.

Accessing Knowledge Refreshers in the Mobile Learner App

If the AIDA add-on is part of your KnowBe4 subscription, AIDA Knowledge Refreshers can be seen on the Training page.

Note: AIDA Knowledge Refreshers must also be enabled in a training campaign to be displayed in the app.

For more information about administering the mobile app, see the FAQ: KnowBe4 Learner App for Admins article.

Training Campaign: User Progress Knowledge Refresher Column

If knowledge refreshers are enabled for your training campaign, you will see a Knowledge Refresher column in the Users subtab on the individual campaign overview page.

Training Activity Reports: Knowledge Refresher Column

If knowledge refreshers are enabled for your training campaign, you can add the Knowledge Refresher column to the Training Activity Reports. The column will display whether or not a user has completed a knowledge refresher for their assigned training. For more information, see the Customize and View Training Activity Reports article.

Filtering the ModStore for Content Compatible with Knowledge Refreshers

The Content Features drop-down menu under Additional Filters on the ModStore tab allows you to filter by content compatible with knowledge refreshers.

articles.title: Integrate Noetic Cyber with Your KnowBe4 Console
articles.body:
In this article, you’ll learn how to integrate your Noetic Cyber account with your KnowBe4 console. This integration allows you to pull your phishing and training data into Noetic Cyber’s Security Asset Management platform.

Note: Before you set up this integration, you'll need to copy the Reporting API Token from your KnowBe4 console Account Settings. For more information, see the API section of our KnowBe4 Console Account Settings: Account Integrations article.

To learn how to integrate your KnowBe4 console with your Noetic Cyber account, follow the steps below.

  1. Log in to your Noetic Cyber account.
  2. From the menu on the left side of the page, select the Connectors icon.
  3. On the Connectors page, click the KnowBe4 tile.
  4. In the KnowBe4 window, click the Settings tab.
  5. In the Global section, paste your Reporting API token in the KnowBe4 API Key field.
  6. Click Save.

After the integration is complete, you’ll see a success message confirming the connection.

KnowBe4 Community Code of Conduct

Our Expectations

KnowBe4 values collaboration among the community. We're committed to providing a user community experience that is harassment-free and an opportunity for all participants to collaborate, learn, participate, and network in an environment that is productive and respectful. We expect members to act professionally, and to interact and communicate in ways that are appropriate for a professional audience from diverse backgrounds.

Behaviors inconsistent with these expectations include (but are not limited to):

  • Harassment, conduct, language, or other action inappropriate for a professional setting that negatively refers to a participants age, physical or mental disability, race, color, ethnicity or national origin, sex, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, physical appearance, religious belief, marital status, or military or veteran status.

Harassment and problematic conduct may include offensive comments (including through jokes and imagery), sexual images or nudity visible to others, deliberate intimidation, stalking, attempts to identify members who have not shared their personal identity (including ‘doxing’), recording, sustained disruption of discussions and unwelcome sexual attention.

Guidelines for Members

For all interactions utilizing the KnowBe4 Community, we expect participants to abide by our Code of Conduct to ensure the community is productive and respectful. The following guidelines will further help ensure we maintain an inclusive environment for all:

  • Be respectful to others.
  • Avoid conflicts and arguments.
  • Use common sense, kindness, and consideration together with the guidelines outlined.

Social Media and Privacy

The KnowBe4 Community is intended for positive professional discussion in a semi-confidential environment. Only active KnowBe4 customers are invited to participate. Users have a reasonable expectation of privacy as they are sharing questions, experiences, and recommendations related to their own professional experiences. Therefore, we insist that all members of the community respect the privacy of others and refrain from sharing what could be potentially confidential information from other users. This includes copying data, identifying information, screenshots, or other information shared by others within the community. Sharing of this information in any public forum, particularly social media, is considered a violation of our Code of Conduct.

Enforcement

If a participant engages in behavior that doesn't comply with the above-mentioned expectations, KnowBe4 may take any action that we deem appropriate, including warning the member, limiting the members ability to comment, suspending or expelling the member entirely from the community, informing the member’s employer, and referring the matter to local authorities in response to extreme and potentially unlawful behavior. Participants asked to stop harassing or other unacceptable behavior are expected to comply immediately. If the participant is a KnowBe4 employee, KnowBe4 also reserves the right to take full disciplinary action pursuant to our internal policies.

Please note that while we take all concerns raised seriously, we'll use our discretion to determine when and how to follow up on reported incidents, and may decline to take any further action, and/or may direct the participant to other resources to address concern.

Reporting an Issue

If you feel that the behavior of a member or members or a topic/discussion is not adhering to these expectations, please contact the KnowBe4 Community team at community@knowbe4.com with a description of the situation and preferably a link to the specific conversation that violates this Code of Conduct.

Thank you for your contribution and participation in the KnowBe4 Community! We thank you for doing your part to create an environment where all participants can collaborate, learn and network productively.

articles.name: PhishER Integrations
articles.title: PhishER Integrations
articles.body:
Below is a list of some of our integrations for PhishER. If you do not see the integration you are looking for, visit our API documentation to learn more about our API's capabilities. For more information on integrations for our other products, see our KSAT Integrations and Phish Alert Button (PAB) Integrations articles.

Note: These integrations are with third parties. We recommend contacting the third party if you need further help with an integration.
  • Blumira is a cloud-based SIEM platform that uses Syslog to obtain PhishER data for security monitoring and incident detection. This integration allows you to centralize and analyze logs to detect and respond to threats.For more information, see the Blumira article Integrating KnowBe4 PhishER With Blumira.
  • Cortex XSOAR is a SOAR platform that automates security operations and incident response. This integration allows you to send PhishER data to other connected platforms through XSOAR, automate manual functions, and send data back to PhishER to change attributes and add tags or comments. To learn about the benefits of this integration, see our Cortex XSOAR and KnowBe4 document.For more information, see our How to Integrate Cortex XSOAR with Your PhishER Platform article and XSOAR's PhishER article.
  • CrowdStrike Falcon Sandbox is a platform that combines with CrowdStrike Falcon Intelligence's threat intelligence service to analyze files and URLs for malicious content. This integration allows you to submit files and URLs for analysis in a sandbox environment, and view a malware analysis report in your PhishER platform or your CrowdStrike Falcon platform. To integrate the CrowdStrike Falcon Sandbox with PhishER, you must have a PhishER Plus subscription and an active CrowdStrike Falcon Intelligence subscription. For more information, see our How to Integrate CrowdStrike with Your PhishER Platform article.
  • FortiSOAR is a SOAR platform from Fortinet that automates your incident response management. This integration allows you to pull emails into PhishER to add and update tags, comments, and dispositions. For more information, see the PhishER integration documentation from FortiSOAR.
  • Onyxia is a cybersecurity management platform that allows you to evaluate and organize your cybersecurity program. With this integration, you can send information from PhishER to Onyxia to get strategic cybersecurity program recommendations. For more information, see our Integrate Onxyia with Your PhishER Console article.
  • Swimlane is a security operations management software that provides workflow tools, such as automated incident response. Their SOAR platform streams your incident response process by integrating your people, processes, and technology.For more information, see Swimlane's integration documentation.
  • Tines is an automation platform that makes it easy for you to offload any of your monotonous workflows, giving you back time to increase your impact. You can connect to any REST API or web application in seconds.For more information, see our Tines and PhishER Webhook Integration article.
  • VirusTotal is a service that inspects and analyzes files for malicious content. A VirusTotal scan is completed using over 70 antivirus scanners. If a file is submitted for a VirusTotal scan, the results will be shared publicly in the VirusTotal community. This integration allows the VirusTotal Public API to conduct scans in PhishER.For more information, see our How to Integrate VirusTotal with Your PhishER Platform article.
  • Webroot provides the BrightCloud Web Classification and Web Reputation Service that uses machine learning-based intelligence to analyze URLs for malicious content. The Threat Intel feature for PhishER Plus is powered by an integration with this Webroot service. Threat Intel uses the Webroot API to allow PhishER to submit URLs for analysis, pull report data, and perform advanced search queries. For more information, see our Integrate Threat Intel with Your PhishER Console article.
  • XM Cyber provides cloud security that helps organizations identify and fix security exposures in their networks. Its Security Control Monitoring (SCM) module provides you with insights into the configuration and activation of security controls. For more information, see our Integrating XM Cyber’s SCM with PhishER article.

In the Security Roles section of your PhishER Settings, you can set the access that users have to your PhishER console. You can add KSAT users to PhishER, create Security Roles to grant or restrict access to PhishER features, and assign Security Roles to your users.

Users

The Users subtab displays all the users who can manage your PhishER console. To add a new user to your console, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your PhishER console.
  2. Navigate to Settings > Users.
  3. Click the Add New User button in the top-right corner of the page. The Add New PhishER User pop-up window will open.
  4. In the Add New PhishER User pop-up window, enter the KSAT email address of the user you would like to add.
  5. Click Add to add the user to PhishER.

After you’ve added the user, you can grant them access to your PhishER console and assign Security Roles to them from the Users subtab. For more information about this subtab, see the screenshot and list below:

  2. Security Roles: This column displays the Security Roles assigned to the user.
  3. Last Login: This column displays the date and time of when the user last logged in to PhishER.
  4. Created At: This column displays the date and time of when the user was added to PhishER.
  5. Has PhishER Access: This column indicates if the user has access to PhishER. You can hover your mouse over the clipboard icon to view the PhishER user who granted the access and the date of when they granted the access.
  6. Actions: You can click the vertical ellipsis icon and select an option to edit a user’s PhishER access. To learn about the options, see the list below:

articles.name: Bitdefender GravityZone Integration Guide for SecurityCoach
articles.title: Bitdefender GravityZone Integration Guide for SecurityCoach
articles.body:
In this article, you'll learn how to integrate Bitdefender GravityZone with SecurityCoach. Once the integration is complete, data provided by Bitdefender GravityZone will be available for use in the SecurityCoach tab of your KSAT console. This data can be viewed in SecurityCoach reports and used to create detection rules for real-time coaching campaigns. For more information about SecurityCoach, see our SecurityCoach Product Manual.

Tip:SecurityCoach also supports integrating Bitdefender GravityZone as a Splunk vendor. If your organization uses Splunk for security information and event management, we recommend integrating through Splunk instead by following our Splunk Integrations Guide for SecurityCoach.

Setting Up the Integration in Bitdefender GravityZone

Before you can set up this integration in your KSAT console, you'll need to copy your Access URL and create an API key in your GravityZone Control Center.

Copying Your Access URL

To copy your Access URL, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your GravityZone Control Center.
  2. Navigate to your account by selecting your profile dropdown menu in the top-right corner and selecting My Account.

  3. Under the Control Center API section, locate your Access URL.

  4. Copy and save the Access URL somewhere that you can easily access. You'll need this URL to complete the integration setup in the Setting Up the Integration in KSAT section below.

Creating Your API Key

After you’ve completed the Copying Your Access URL section, create your API key by following the steps below:

  1. Log in to your GravityZone Control Center.
    1. Navigate to your account by selecting your profile dropdown menu in the top-right corner and selecting My Account.

  2. In the API keys section, click + Add. An API key pop-up window will appear.

  3. In the API Key Description field, enter a description. In the Enabled APIs section, select the Event Push Service API check box.

  4. Click Save to create your new API key.
  5. Under the API keys section, click your new API Key.

  6. In the API key pop-up window that opens, copy and save the Key somewhere that you can easily access. You will need this key to complete the integration setup in the Setting Up the Integration in KSAT section below.

Setting Up the Integration in KSAT

Once you have completed the Setting Up the Integration in Bitdefender GravityZone section of this article, you can set up the integration in your KSAT console. To register Bitdefender GravityZone in your KSAT console, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KSAT console
  2. Navigate to SecurityCoach > Setup > Security Vendor Integrations.
  3. Locate the Bitdefender GravityZone tile and click Configure.
  4. Enter the Access URL and API Key that you saved in the Setting Up the Integration in Bitdefender GravityZone section of this article.

  5. Click Connect.

Mapping Your Users

After you’ve finished integrating Bitdefender GravityZone, we recommend mapping your users through mapping rules, or through a CSV file upload. For more information about user mapping, see our Map Users in SecurityCoach article.

Once you’ve successfully authorized this integration, you can manage detection rules for Bitdefender GravityZone on the Detection Rules subtab of SecurityCoach. For a full list of available system detection rules for this vendor, see our System Detection Rules By Vendor article.

articles.body:
You may want to send a message to encourage your users to log in to the Learner Experience (LX) and explore its features. Below, we have provided you with example text that you can use as a template for composing your message. Be sure to review and change the example text to align with your organization.

Creating Your Template

To create your template, select an introduction based on how your organization logs in to the LX. You can click the drop-down headers below to view an example introduction for each login method.

  • The example text below is for organizations that send LX enrollment emails to their users. Ensure you replace the [x] placeholder with your organization's contact information.

    Example Text

    You may be aware that we're using the KnowBe4 Learner Experience (LX) for your training assignments. We wanted to encourage you to take a moment to log in to the LX and tour its features if you haven't yet. You should have already received an enrollment email with a link to confirm your account and log in for training. If you did not receive this email, please reach out to [x].

  • The example text below is for organizations that send users a link to their KnowBe4 training login page. Ensure you replace the [x] placeholder with your organization's training link.

    Example Text

    You may be aware that we’re using the KnowBe4 Learner Experience (LX) for your training assignments. We wanted to encourage you to take a moment to log in to the LX and tour its features if you haven't yet. If you haven’t already signed up for the LX, you can use this link to sign up for a new account: [x]

  • The example text below is for organizations that use single sign-on for the LX. Ensure you replace the [SSO Provider] placeholder with your organization's SSO provider.

    Example Text

    You may be aware that we’re using the KnowBe4 Learner Experience (LX) for your training assignments. We wanted to encourage you to take a moment to log in to the LX and tour its features if you haven't yet. You can automatically sign in to the LX through [SSO Provider].

  • The example text below is for organizations that use password-less login links for the LX. Ensure you replace the [x] placeholder with your organization's contact information.

    Example Text

    You may be aware that we're using the KnowBe4 Learner Experience (LX) for your training assignments. You should have already received an email with a training link. If you did not receive this email, please reach out to [x].

After choosing an introduction from the above options, add the example text below to your introduction. Ensure you review and change the text to include only the features your organization has enabled for the LX.

Example Text

When you first log in to the LX, you may want to set your preferred language. To do so, click your name in the top-right corner of the page and then click the language at the bottom of the drop-down menu.

Next, we recommend taking a look at your dashboard. Your dashboard includes your training progress, phishing test results, badges, messages, and Personal Risk Score. If you have direct reports, you'll also see your team dashboard.

If you have any training assignments, you can access them from your dashboard or the Training tab. You can also find optional learning content on the Library tab.

To learn more, see the Learner Support Guide: Navigating the Learner Experience.

Thanks for your cooperation,Organization Name

Example Message

Below is an example message created using the text from the Creating Your Template section above.

Dear John Doe,

You may be aware that we're using the KnowBe4 Learner Experience (LX) for your training assignments. We wanted to encourage you to take a moment to log in to the LX and tour its features if you haven't yet. You should have already received an enrollment email with a link to confirm your account and log in for training. If you did not receive this email, please reach out to it@organization.com.

When you first log in to the LX, you may want to set your preferred language. To do so, click your name in the top-right corner of the page and then click the language at the bottom of the drop-down menu.

Next, we recommend taking a look at your dashboard. Your dashboard includes your training progress, phishing test results, badges, messages, and Personal Risk Score. If you have direct reports, you'll also see your team dashboard.

If you have any training assignments, you can access them from your dashboard or the Training tab. You can also find optional learning content on the Library tab.

To learn more, see the Learner Support Guide: Navigating the Learner Experience.

articles.body:
In this article, you'll learn about the Account Information section of your KSAT account settings. In the Account Information section, you can review your subscription details, update your privacy settings, update your organization’s information, and more.

Purchased Products and Add-ons

In the Purchased Products and Add-ons section, you can view information about the KnowBe4 products and add-ons you’ve purchased. This information includes the following information about your KSAT account:

  • Your subscription level.
  • Your subscription end date.
  • The number of seats available on your account.
  • The number of active users on your account.

This section also includes your subscription end date for other products and add-ons you’ve purchased such as PhishER, CompliancePlus, KnowBe4 Student Edition, PasswordIQ, and SecurityCoach.

Tip: If you’d like to change your subscription details, contact your Account Manager or Customer Success Manager.

Account Privacy

In the Account Privacy section, you can check if KnowBe4 agents have access to your account and change your privacy settings to your liking.

To change your account privacy settings, click the Allow KnowBe4 agents to access this account drop-down menu. To temporarily grant access to your account, select your preferred time period from the drop-down menu. We recommend that you select Allow continual access to allow KnowBe4 agents to access your account. Granting access to KnowBe4 agents allows us to access your account and assist you if you experience technical issues in your account.

The blue banner at the top of the section displays the expiry date of the account access. Once the access expires, your setting will be automatically updated to Do not allow access.

If you select Do not allow access, our support team will not be able to access your account. If you don’t allow access, you may experience some delays if our support team needs to view your account to help solve a technical issue.

For more information about account privacy settings, see our Grant Support Access to Your Account article.

Organization Information

In the Organization Information section, you can update your organization’s name, business hours, time zone, and other information about your organization.

KSAT uses placeholders to populate this information into features such as phishing templates, landing pages, and training notifications. For more information, see our Placeholders Guide.

See below for information about specific settings in this section:

  1. Allowed Domains: If your email environment includes multiple email domains, you can click Allowed Domains to add more subdomains or root domains to your KnowBe4 account. For more information, see our Add and Verify Domains article.
  2. Business Hours: Click the clock icon to add your organization’s default business hours. This setting determines the default time period that PSTs and time-sensitive training notifications will be sent. It also determines the default start time for training campaigns. You can set different business hours or a different start time when creating a campaign.
  3. Business Days: Click the corresponding button for each of your organization’s default business days. This setting determines the default start date when creating a phishing campaign. You can select a different start time when creating phishing or training campaigns.
  4. Time Zone: Click the drop-down menu and select your organization’s default time zone. For more information about managing time zones in your console, see our Manage Your Time Zones article.
  5. Default Admin Console Language: Click the drop-down menu and select a default language for your admin console. The language you select will apply to the entire admin console unless an admin selects a different Admin Console Language. If a user’s language is not available, the account’s default language will be used. For more information, see our Localization Guide.
  6. Date and Time Format: Click the drop-down menu and select the default date and time format that you’d like to use in the console. After you select a default date and time format, any new users that you import will see the default setting in their user profile. The date and time format options are listed below:
    • 12-hour
      MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm AM/PM
      Example: 01/31/2022 02:00 PM

    • 24-hour
      DD/MM/YYYY HH:mm
      Example: 31/01/2022 14:00

Environment Information

In the Environment Information section, you can view and edit your responses to the Environment Survey available on your KnowBe4 console dashboard. This section will not be available in your account settings until you have submitted your responses to the survey. Additionally, you can return to the survey at any time by clicking Edit Account Information. You can also remove all responses that you have submitted by clicking Clear All Responses. For more information, see our Environment Survey Overview article.

Branding

In the Branding section, you can customize your organization’s branded content. We recommend that you use branded content to provide a familiar learning environment for your users.

See below for more information about the settings in this section:

  1. Company Logo URL: Enter the URL for your company logo to use the logo in templates. If you add your logo URL to the console, you can use the logo in phishing templates, landing pages, and training notifications. For information about logo requirements, see our Add Your Company Logo, Logo URL, and Brand Color to Your Console article.
  2. Company Logo: Upload an image of your company logo to personalize your users’ Learner Experience. This logo will replace the KnowBe4 logo at the top-left of the page when users log in to the Learner Experience. For information about logo requirements, see our Add Your Company Logo, Logo URL, and Brand Color to Your Console article.
  3. Brand Color: Select a theme color for your Learner Experience. We recommend that you match the color to your organization's brand or logo color.
  4. Upload Branded Certificate: This setting allows you to design and upload a custom branded template for your certificates. If you upload a branded certificate, you can click Preview Current Certificate to view the certificate. For more information, see our Create a Branded Training Certificate article.
  5. + Placeholders: Click this button to add a custom banner, prefix, or signature block to your phishing emails. You can use these elements to customize phishing emails to match your organization’s brand. This can also help when your banners, prefixes, or signatures no longer appear on phishing emails due to whitelisting rules. For more information, see our DMI Configuration Guide.

Placeholders

In the Placeholders section, you can customize specific placeholders for your organization. For example, you can customize placeholders to add a custom banner, prefix, or signature block to your phishing emails. This customization can also help when your banners, prefixes, or signatures no longer appear on phishing emails due to whitelisting rules. For more information, see our DMI Configuration Guide.

To learn more about customizing placeholders, see the table below:

Placeholder Drop-Down Menu Option Description
Email Banner [[email_banner]]

Allows you to set a custom email banner for phishing emails.

You can also set the banner to automatically appear on all phishing emails or phishing emails delivered with Direct Message Injection (DMI).

Subject Prefix [[subject_prefix]]

Allows you to set a custom subject prefix for phishing emails.

You can also set the subject prefix to automatically appear on all phishing emails or phishing emails delivered with DMI.

Display Name [[display_name]]

Allows you to set how the display name placeholder populates in the console. You can choose from the four options below:

  • [First Name] [Last Name]: Displays the user’s first name and then the user’s last name. This option is selected by default.
  • [First Name]: Displays only the user’s first name.
  • [Last Name]: Displays only the user’s last name.
  • [Last Name] [First Name]: Displays the user’s last name and then the user’s first name.

If all related fields in the user’s profile are blank, the display name placeholder will populate the user's email address instead.
Signature Block [[signature]]

Allows you to set how the signature block placeholder populates in the console.
Sender Name [[prt_sender_name]]

Allows you to set how the sender name placeholder populates in the console.
Sender Email [[prt_sender_email]]

Allows you to set how the sender email placeholder populates in the console.

articles.name: Product API Overview
articles.title: Product API Overview
articles.body:
In your KSAT console, you can create Product application programming interface (API) tokens for other KnowBe4 products. These API tokens allow you to connect KSAT with your other tools or platforms, such as PhishER. For example, when KSAT and PhishER are connected, you can authenticate your KnowBe4 account when you make an API request.

Creating a Product API Token

To create a Product API token, follow the steps below:

Important:If you're a Partner or Multi-Account Organization, you'll need to log into the management admin account to create the Product API token.
  1. From your KSAT console, click your email address at the top-right corner of the page and select Account Settings.
  2. Navigate to Account Integrations > API.
  3. Under Product API, click Product API. The Product API subtab will open.
  4. At the top-right corner of the Product API subtab, click + Create New API Token.
  5. Fill out the fields on the Create New API Token page. For more information, see the screenshot and list below:
    1. Name: In this field, enter a descriptive name for this API token.
    2. Products: Select the product you'll use for this API token.
    3. Scopes: This field will only appear if you select KSAT or SecurityCoach. Select whether you want your users to have Read Only access, or the ability to make edits with the Read/Write permission.
    4. Expiration Date: Select the date when the API token should expire. When this token expires, KSAT will not be able to send data to the product. To continue sending data to the product, you’ll need to create a new API token.
    5. User: In this drop-down menu, select the user responsible for managing this API token. For example, you could select a user who has administrator access to the product.
    6. Status: Enable or disable the API token.
  6. Click Create Token. The Product API Token pop-up window will open.
  7. Click the Product API token to copy the token. Make sure to save your copied API token somewhere that you can easily access. After you close this window, you will not be able to view this token again.
  8. Click OK.

Once copied, you can use the API token to set up a connection in your other KnowBe4 products. For more information, see the articles listed below:

  • How to Integrate KnowBe4's KSAT Console with KCM GRC
  • KnowBe4 Graph API Overview
  • Password IQ Product Manual

Managing Product API Tokens

Once you have created a Product API token, you can manage the token on the Product API subtab. You can access this subtab from the Account Integrations section of your Account Settings page.

Note:You can view only the last 10 digits of your Product API tokens after they have been created. If you lose a token, you’ll need to create a new one.

To learn more about the options available on this subtab, see below:

  1. Key: This column displays a unique identifier used to authenticate an API request associated with your KSAT console.
  2. Name: This column displays the custom name you assigned to your API token when it was created.
  3. Product: This column displays the product that can be connected to the KSAT console using your API token.
  4. User: This column displays the user assigned to manage this API token.
  5. Expiration Date: This column displays the date your API token will expire. When this token expires, KSAT will not be able to send data to the product. To continue sending data to the product, you’ll need to create a new API token.
  6. Status: This column displays the API token’s status. The status can be enabled or disabled.
  7. Actions: Click the drop-down arrow in the rightmost column to view the available actions for a Product API token. These actions include:
    • Edit: Click Edit to open the Edit Product API Token page, which is similar to the Create New API Token page. Edit options as needed, then click Update Token to save your changes.
    • Delete: Click Delete to permanently delete a Product API token.

articles.name: FAQ: KnowBe4 Learner App for Admins
articles.title: FAQ: KnowBe4 Learner App for Admins
articles.body:
The KnowBe4 Learner App is a mobile application available for Android and iOS devices. The app allows your users to access their security awareness and compliance training anytime and anywhere. Users can also use the app to view their messages, badges, and more.

In this article, you’ll find frequently asked questions that admins may have about the KnowBe4 Learner App. If you don't see the answer you need, submit a ticket to our support team. For general information about the app, see our KnowBe4 Learner App article.

How can I demo the app before enabling it for my users?

You can demo the app by following the steps below:

  1. From your KSAT console, click your email address at the top-right corner of the page and select Account Settings.
  2. In your Account Settings, navigate to Training > Learner Experience.
  3. Locate the KnowBe4 Learner App section.
  4. Click Demo KnowBe4 Learner App to enable the app for yourself. When you click this link, your Learner Experience (LX) will open.
  5. Once you're in your LX, follow the instructions in our KnowBe4 Learner App article to download and use the app.

The KnowBe4 Learner App tab will display in your LX for 30 minutes. Other users will not be able to see this tab. After 30 minutes, the tab will no longer display in your LX, but you will not be logged out of the app.

How do I enable or disable the app for my users?

You can enable or disable the app in your Account Settings by following the steps below:

  1. From your KnowBe4 console, click your email address at the top-right of the page and select Account Settings.
  2. In your Account Settings, navigate to Training > Learner Experience.
  3. Locate the KnowBe4 Learner App section.
    1. To enable the app for your users, select the Enable KnowBe4 Learner App check box.
    2. To disable the app for your users, deselect the Enable KnowBe4 Learner App check box.

If the KnowBe4 Learner App is enabled for your users, they can see setup instructions in their Learner Experience. For more information on how your users can set up the app, see our KnowBe4 Learner App article.

Important: Once a user has linked a device to their account, the user will remain logged in on that device. If the user is archived or deleted, they will be logged out. Users can also choose to log out manually from the Profile section in the app.

When the KnowBe4 Learner App is disabled, your users can download it from their app store but cannot log in and access their training assignments.

Can I send users a login link for the app?

Yes, from your Account Settings page, you can send users an invitation email with instructions on downloading the KnowBe4 Learner App. Once downloaded, users can click the link or scan the QR code in the email to automatically log in to the app. 

Alternatively, users can request a link directly from the app. For more information, see our Learner Support: KnowBe4 Learner App article. 

Note:Admins can send app invite links up to five times each day. Users can also request a login link from the app up to five times each day. Once you reach the limit for the day, you will not be able to send or receive the link.

To send an invitation email, follow the steps below.

  1. In your KSAT console, navigate to Account Settings > Training > Learner Experience.
  2. In the KnowBe4 Learner App section, select your desired groups from the Select Notification Recipients drop-down menu.
  3. Click Send. All users in the selected groups will immediately be sent an invitation email.
Note: For security purposes, the links and QR codes in these emails will be deactivated after 24 hours.

Can I use my mobile device management (MDM) to manage the app for my users?

Yes, you can use your MDM solution to manage the app for your users. We support the most popular MDM solutions, including Microsoft Intune and Jamf. Because these MDMs are third parties, we recommend contacting the relevant third party if you need further help.

Did you find that the app doesn't support your MDM? Please let your Customer Success Manager know.

Are there resources available to introduce my organization to the KnowBe4 Learner App?

Yes! We encourage you to use the resources listed below. 

  • Admin One-Pager (PDF): This one-pager was written for admins, and it highlights the benefits of using the mobile app. 
  • Promotional Overview Video: This video gives an overview of the mobile app so that users can get the most out of their experience.
  • User-facing Poster: This poster encourages users to try the mobile app and lists some of its benefits. The poster is available in three sizes: 8.5 x 11 inches (in), 11 x 17 in, and 18 x 24 in.

As an admin, how do I download the app and link it to my device?

You can download the app and link it to your device from your Learner Experience. To go to your Learner Experience, log in to your KnowBe4 console and click on your email address at the top-right of the page. Then, select My Training from the drop-down menu.

Once you're in your Learner Experience, follow the instructions in our KnowBe4 Learner App article to download and use the app.

Can users view custom training content in the app?

Your users will be able to view custom training content in the KnowBe4 Learner App. Keep this in mind when uploading custom content. For example, if your content contains external links, consider whether or not those links can be viewed on a mobile device. If your custom training content should only be accessed in the Learner Experience, you can indicate this by selecting Not Recommended for KnowBe4 Learner App when uploading your content.

Content with this setting selected will have a Not Recommended for Mobile banner in the app. If the user taps on the piece of content, the page that opens will include a message directing the user to use their Learner Experience. Even with this setting enabled, users can still access and complete the content using the KnowBe4 Learner App.

For information about custom training content, see our Uploading Custom Content to Your KnowBe4 Platform article.

Can users access their training in the app without an internet connection?

Your users can download training content in the app. Once downloaded, users can access the training content with or without an internet connection. Be aware that custom content cannot be downloaded in the app at this time.

For more information about downloading content, see our Learner Support: KnowBe4 Learner App article.

Why is there a minimum version requirement for the app?

To ensure the best user experience, the KnowBe4 Learner App requires the app to operate on version 2.0 or later. If a user opens the app in an outdated version, the screen will display an error message and instruct them to update the app from their device’s app store.
